intro: Selago villicaulis, commonly known as the silky selago, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Selago villicaulis is often found in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
